io.vertx.ext.auth.spi

Interface AuthProvider


  • public interface AuthProvider
    This interface is implemented by auth providers which provide the actual auth functionality - e.g. we have a implementation which uses Apache Shiro.

    If you wish to use the auth service with other providers, implement this interface for your provider.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void hasPermission(Object principal, String permission, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
      Handle whether a principal has a permission
      void hasRole(Object principal, String role, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(JsonObject config)
        The auth service will call this when the service is created
        Parameters:
        config - - the config to pass to your implementation

      • login

        void login(JsonObject credentials,
           Handler<AsyncResult<Object>> resultHandler)
        Handle the actual login
        Parameters:
        credentials - the credentials - this can contain anything your provider expects
        resultHandler - - this must return a failed result if login fails and it must return a succeeded result which contains the `principal` object representing the logged in entity.

      • hasRole

        void hasRole(Object principal,
             String role,
             Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Handle whether a principal has a role
        Parameters:
        principal - the principal object that you returned from login(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject, io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.core.AsyncResult<java.lang.Object>>).
        role - the role
        resultHandler - this must return a failure if the check could not be performed - e.g. the principal is not known. Otherwise it must return a succeeded result which contains a boolean `true` if the principal has the role, or `false` if they do not have the role.

      • hasPermission

        void hasPermission(Object principal,
                   String permission,
                   Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Handle whether a principal has a permission
        Parameters:
        principal - the principal object that you returned from login(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject, io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.core.AsyncResult<java.lang.Object>>).
        permission - the permission
        resultHandler - this must return a failure if the check could not be performed - e.g. the principal is not known. Otherwise it must return a succeeded result which contains a boolean `true` if the principal has the permission, or `false` if they do not have the permission.
